args: With more and more dragons on our side, \nAlberius's army cruised from victory to victory\nwith tremendous momentum.
At the same time, those displaced by the war,\nas well as defectors from the Empire, began to\ngather at the Halidom.
A refugee village, near the Halidom
It's Alberius!\nAnd Myriam is with him!
Tell me, friends: is there anything you\nrequire? Please do not hesitate to make\nyour needs known.
You've done more than enough simply\nby taking us in.
On the contrary; it is we who would\nlike to help you. Just say the word.
Your smiling faces are reward enough,\nfriends.
We've finished distributing supplies to\nthose in need. I've got Tartarus bringing\nmore, but I fear we may yet run short.
There are more and more refugees here\nevery day.
The other cities and countries of the \nalliance are unable, or unwilling, to\nshelter any more.
The Halidom has become these people's\nsole ray of light in the darkness of war.
Even if we defeat the Empire,\nthis problem won't go away.
Not until these displaced souls\nfind a new land to call their own.
If only you were a king,\nwith your own kingdom...
Me? A king?\nI'm not cut out to rule a country.
I wouldn't be so sure. You saw the\nway those villagers looked at you.
They're trying to put the horrors they've\nwitnessed behind them and live anew.
They can only do so because you, in all\nyour kindness, have enabled them to.
You are the heir to the dragonblood—\na true hero. The people adore you.\nYou've all the makings of a king.
Excuse me, sir. There's a message\nfrom the main allied force.
Is Mym around? I've got some gripes about\nJupiter I need to get off my chest.
Mym left with Alberius to visit \nallied headquarters.
The Curia has finally sanctioned his\nposition as official leader of the allied\nforces.
I thought he already was the boss.
In practice, yes. But there was always \nsome opposition to him formally taking\non the role.
Feh. Humans and their affairs are \nalways so complicated.
As of today, Alberius will truly become\na leader in name as well as deed.
August Cathedral\nHome base of the allied anti-imperial forces
Alberius, hero of the sacred sword.\nLead our forces, and usher in a new\nera of justice for our noble land.
This man is now the standard-bearer of\nthe allied forces. Ladies and gentlemen,\nplease join me in a round of applause.
Hmph. How disgraceful that the Curia\nshould recognize a commoner such as he.
It is only thanks to Alberius that we\nare on the verge of winning this war.\nWhat do you find so objectionable?
I cannot deny his military prowess. It is\nwhat happens after the war that worries\nme.
Former imperial territories will be divided\namongst us based on our military records.
The allied leader will naturally be\nentitled to the lion's share of the spoils.
Land should be ruled by the educated—\nthose with standing. It ill suits the people\nfor a commoner to assert such power.
You trouble yourself over spoils when\nwe should be fighting as one?
Mind your tongue.\nOnly a fool fails to consider the future.
As the good man says, it is crucial to\ntake post-war planning into account.
How reasonable of you. I take it you are\nprepared to renounce your claim when it\ncomes time to divide up the land, then.
No. I intend to personally preside over\nany lands I liberate from the Empire.
War roils across the land like a storm,\nleaving naught but destruction in its wake.
If I do not rise to shepherd the people\nthrough a hard-won era of peace, then\nI cannot claim to have saved anything.
With these very hands, I will build a\nland where they can live in tranquility.\nSuch is my duty as a hero.
Pretty words are just that—words.\nDo you truly believe yourself capable?
Yes. Because I will not do so alone.\nThe dragons will aid me.
And I have a most capable adjutant who\nsupports me with advice.

Let it be known to all here: when this war
is over, my people and I will work together
to build a kingdom where we can live in
peace and prosperity.
And I will not reject anyone who wishes\nto join me.
So you would have us swear fealty to you?\nAs vassals?
Not at all. I would offer that we live\nas equals.
I didn't expect you to say all that\nin front of THEM.
I've been thinking about it for a while. \nAbout what I can do once the fighting\nis done.
You've given me the language to \nproperly express myself at last.
I have the makings of a king—you said it\nyourself. That is why I have decided to\ncraft a kingdom and become one.
It may be small, but it will be a home\nto the displaced and the suffering—a\nbastion where we can protect them.
A land led by King Alberius...\nIt sounds lovely.\nIf anyone can do it, it's you.
I realize I'm jumping ahead here,\nbut I need to ask you something.
I can't build the ideal kingdom by myself.\nI need stalwart friends I can depend on.
With that said, Mym...will you help me?
Actually, perhaps I should get a\nhead start on saying this now...
Shortly after, the Empire gained an infamous\nmage as the Other's right hand, and mounted\na fierce attack on the allied forces.
The tide of war turned, and we found ourselves\nbacked into a corner. Until...
